data.title: Louise, Queen of Prussia and her husband Frederick William III, King of Prussia
data.meta_description: Frederick William (1770-1840) was the eldest son of Frederick William II, whom he succeeded as King of Prussia in 1797, and Frederica, daughter of Louis IX, Landgrave of Hesse-Darmstadt. In 1793, he married Louisa, daughter of Charles, Grand Duke of Mecklenburg-Strelitz, whose miniature by Rochstuhl is framed together with his own. His second marriage in 1813 was to Augusta, countess of Harrach. In 1813, he joined Tsar Alexander I in alliance against Napoleon.Peter Ernest Rockstuhl (1764-1824) worked as a...
